intro: Proferea, commonly known as the giant redwood, is a towering conifer native to the coastal forests of California and Oregon. It belongs to the family Pinaceae and is characterized by its massive, reddish-barked trunk and long, needle-like leaves. The plant can grow up to 300 feet tall, making it one of the tallest living organisms on Earth. Its roots form extensive networks that help stabilize the soil and support other plant life. Proferea plays a crucial role in its ecosystem by providing habitat for various wildlife species.
